instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.D7012: What is D7012? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year model macbook airs, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0 9amp DRAW
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 8.19V

PP3v42 is 3.42V

Machine not getting on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0 9amp DRAW
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 3.4V

<SIGNAL>PP18V5_DCIN_ISOL_R</SIGNAL> is 16.5V instead of 18.5V

No History of any corrosion. There was a lot of dust on the back side of the board. Cleaned it properly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0 9amp DRAW
threads.message:
Why do you expect 18.5V there?
Read the nominal output voltage marked on any Magsafe charger, according with its power rate!

8.19V is incorrect voltage and denotes bad communication between SMC and <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

Be sure <RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR> is good.
Check voltage and diode mode to ground on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

You may have bad solders underneath SMC; should try reballing it.
If still the same, replace it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0 9amp DRAW
threads.message:
Diode Mode Reading to Ground

<RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR> is .540

SCL/SDA Lines of the Battery Connector 
Voltage 3.4V on both
Diode Mode
SCL is .553
SDA is .549

threads.message:
"<RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR> is .540"
I meant its real ohm value (between pins), not diode mode to ground.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0 9amp DRAW
threads.message:
It worked for a day but now the device wont take charge no Magsafe light. 
The machine is on.

Removed Battery and connected the charger. Same.


If we disconnect and reconnect J9500 , it will take charge sometimes.

It is working fine when connected to the PSU. Checked 2-3 times.

Is it that problem where it akes charge from a copy charger and not from an original charger ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0 9amp DRAW
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0 9amp DRAW
threads.message: I ordered a knock off charger. It is working absolutely fine on the knock off charger. Still SMC Reball ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0 9amp DRAW
threads.message:
Machine should work with original charger.
You didn't specify actual <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage (original charger).

If DCIN voltage is low, then check R/<DIODE>D7012</DIODE> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0 9amp DRAW
threads.message:
On Original Charger there is no steady Voltage on PPBUS. Its 2V and reducing.
I ll check DCIN Voltage and update
